content.description:
An interesting climb with many holds to choose from. Climb slightly right ofSpruce Leeup the face through a big pocket to a large ledge with anchors.

Bolted anchor

intriguing, sustained face climbing leads to a set of anchors at the horizontal ledge. Save some juice for the finish.

Bolted anchor

Follow bolts in the middle of the face to a small ledge. Traverse left of the bolt on rails and up through a delicate/powerful crux to anchors.
NEW BOLT part-way up protecting old runout (2017)

Bolted anchor

A straightforward start leads to a tricky stemming corner move to the ledge. Keep an eye out for key holds on either side of you through the crux bulge... 

Note that a good hold broke on the crux section making it more tricky...

Farther right climb
Bolted anchor

5.12++? (needs more sends to confirm grade) Perhaps the best climb on the wall, Zatoichi starts a couple metres left of Ichibang up a small corner then a balancy step left onto the black streak and through a bulge to a rest. It is highly recommended to jump on this climb even just to this point avoiding the harder terrain above and goes at 5.10+/11-?. For the true Blademasters, continue up the dark streak above emptying out your full bag of tricks through multiple cruxes in order to become a true Sport Climbing Samurai.

Bolted anchor

The climbing here is generally technical face climbing on edges (and the odd pocket) on vertical to slightly overhanging solid, coarse granite. The wall stays dry in light rain, unless there's a strong west wind and doesn't seep.

***NEW***Â Set of anchors at the top of Woman's Touch. Now there's a set of anchors at the top of each climb. Not shown on the photo below.
-----------Hand-line installed to connect top anchors of Spruce Lee,Ichibang and Zatoichi. Easy to throw a top rope on Ichibang from the top of Spruce and likewise for Zatoichi.
